definitions.definition: fit panes of glass into (a window or doorframe or similar structure).
examples: windows can be glazed using laminated glass

definitions.definition: overlay or cover (food, fabric, etc.) with a smooth, shiny coating or finish.
examples: new potatoes that had been glazed in mint-flavored butter
synonyms: paint; Moregloss "the pots are glazed when dry"cover

examples: the prospect makes my eyes glaze over with boredom

definitions.definition: a vitreous substance fused on to the surface of pottery to form a hard, impervious decorative coating.
examples: varnish, enamel, lacquer, finish, coating; Moreluster, shine, gloss "pottery with a blue glaze"Moreluster, shine, gloss pottery with a blue glaze

definitions.definition: a smooth, shiny surface formed by glazing.
examples: the glaze of the white cups

definitions.definition: a thin topcoat of transparent paint used to modify the tone of an underlying color.
a liquid such as milk or beaten egg, used to form a smooth shiny coating on food.
examples: coating, topping; Moreicing, frosting "a cake with an apricot glaze"Moreicing, frosting a cake with an apricot glaze

definitions.definition: a thin, glassy coating of ice on the ground or the surface of water.
